question:
Due to which of the following reason, roads were a low priority area of government investment during British India?
1) Road construction was said to have been too costly in India.
2) Roads brought the government no monetary return.
3) The lobbies that pushed the government into investment in modern transportation clearly wanted railways.
Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
explanation:
Due to the following reasons, roads were a low priority area of government investment during British India
1) Road construction was said to have been too costly in India.
2) Roads brought the government no monetary return.
3) The lobbies that pushed the government into investment in modern transportation clearly wanted railways.
